price_objections.objection: The price is too high / I can't afford that
price_objections.underlying_concern: Fear of financial strain or being taken advantage of
price_objections.poor_response: This is already our best price / That's what it's worth
price_objections.authentic_response: I understand budget is important. Let's look at what monthly payment works for you, and I can show you vehicles in that range. We can also discuss different financing terms or down payment options. What monthly payment would be comfortable for your situation?
price_objections.validation_approach: Acknowledge financial concerns are valid, focus on finding actual solutions within their budget

trust_objections.objection: I've heard bad things about car dealers / I don't want to get ripped off
trust_objections.underlying_concern: Past negative experiences or stories, fear of being manipulated
trust_objections.poor_response: We're not like other dealers / You can trust us
trust_objections.authentic_response: I completely understand that concern—there's a reason car dealers have that reputation, and I'm sorry if you've had a bad experience. Here's how we're different: [specific policies like return guarantee, independent inspection option, transparent pricing]. I encourage you to read our reviews, and you're welcome to have any vehicle inspected by your own mechanic before purchase. What would help you feel more comfortable?
trust_objections.validation_approach: Acknowledge the industry's reputation honestly, provide concrete evidence and third-party validation

vehicle_condition_objections.objection: What if something breaks right after I buy it?
vehicle_condition_objections.underlying_concern: Fear of inheriting someone else's problem, financial vulnerability
vehicle_condition_objections.poor_response: It's a used car, things happen / That's why we have warranties
vehicle_condition_objections.authentic_response: That's a smart question. Here's what we do: [describe inspection process], and this vehicle comes with [warranty details or AS-IS disclosure]. I can also show you the vehicle history report and you're welcome to have your mechanic inspect it. Would a [warranty option] give you peace of mind? Let's talk about what protection makes sense for your situation.
vehicle_condition_objections.validation_approach: Never minimize the concern, be transparent about vehicle condition and what is/isn't covered

timing_objections.objection: I need to think about it / I'm just looking
timing_objections.underlying_concern: Feeling pressured, need to consult spouse/family, not ready emotionally or financially
timing_objections.poor_response: What's there to think about? / If you leave, this car will be gone
timing_objections.authentic_response: Absolutely, this is a big decision. What specific concerns do you need to think through? [Listen] Is there information I can provide that would help? Would it be useful to take my card and call me when you're ready, or would you like to schedule a time to come back with [spouse/mechanic/family member]?
timing_objections.validation_approach: Remove pressure, identify real barriers, make it easy to re-engage when ready

comparison_objections.objection: I found a cheaper one online / I want to check other dealers
comparison_objections.underlying_concern: Fear of missing better deal, need to feel they've done due diligence
comparison_objections.poor_response: That one probably has problems / You won't find better than this
comparison_objections.authentic_response: Smart move to compare—I'd do the same thing. Can you show me the listing? [Review together] Here's what I notice about the differences: [honest comparison of mileage, condition, features, warranty]. You should absolutely check it out. If you'd like, I can hold this one with a refundable deposit while you do your research. What factors are most important to you in making the decision?
comparison_objections.validation_approach: Support their comparison shopping, help them evaluate apples-to-apples, stand behind your value

credit_objections.objection: My credit isn't good / I probably can't get financed
credit_objections.underlying_concern: Shame about financial past, fear of rejection and wasting time
credit_objections.poor_response: Let's just run your credit and see / Bad credit is no problem
credit_objections.authentic_response: I appreciate you being upfront about that. We work with several lenders who specialize in different credit situations. Many of our customers have rebuilt their credit through a car loan with us. Would you be comfortable sharing your approximate credit score or situation? That way I can give you realistic expectations before we do anything. There's no judgment here—we help people in all kinds of situations.
credit_objections.validation_approach: Remove shame, be realistic about options, protect their dignity throughout process

trade_in_objections.objection: You're not giving me enough for my trade
trade_in_objections.underlying_concern: Emotional attachment to current vehicle, need to feel respected, financial gap
trade_in_objections.poor_response: That's what it's worth / Take it or leave it
trade_in_objections.authentic_response: I understand you feel your vehicle is worth more. Let me show you how we arrived at this number: [show market comparables, condition factors]. I can see you've taken care of it. The reality is wholesale market value is [X], and we have to account for [reconditioning costs, market demand]. If the gap is the issue, let's look at whether a different vehicle purchase price works better, or if you'd do better selling it privately. What would make this work for you?
trade_in_objections.validation_approach: Show your work, acknowledge their care for the vehicle, focus on solving the real problem

🧵 5 red flags when buying a used car (from someone who's seen it all):

1/ MISMATCHED PAINT
Run your finger along panel gaps. Feel texture differences? Different sheen in sunlight? That's repaint work. Not always bad, but ask WHY. Accident? Rust repair? You deserve to know.

2/ "JUST DETAILED" OBSESSIVELY
Fresh detail = great. OVERLY detailed = suspicious. Strong air freshener? New floor mats on old car? They might be hiding smoke smell, pet odors, or worse. Trust your nose.

3/ SELLER WON'T LET YOU INSPECT
"My mechanic already checked it" isn't good enough. If they won't let YOUR mechanic look, walk away. Legit sellers welcome inspections. Shady ones block them.

4/ TITLE ISSUES
Salvage title = major accident/flood. Rebuilt title = fixed but forever marked. Not insurable by some companies. Affects resale. If price seems too good, check the title FIRST.

5/ RUSHED SALE PRESSURE
"Another buyer coming tonight" "Price goes up tomorrow" "Cash only, today" = 🚩🚩🚩

birthday_offers.goal: Personal touch, brings them in, opportunity for face-to-face relationship building

dual_incentive.offer: $200 to referrer, $200 off to referred customer when they purchase
dual_incentive.structure: Referrer gets Visa gift card at friend's delivery, friend gets discount at purchase
dual_incentive.promotion: Yard signs in sold cars: 'Refer a friend - You both get $200', business cards with referral code

family_plan.offer: Every family member who buys gets $300 off, original customer gets $100 per family purchase
family_plan.structure: Unlimited - we've had families with 5+ vehicles from us
family_plan.promotion: 'We take care of families' - testimonials from multi-generational customers

social_sharing_bonus.offer: $50 gift card for posting photo with new car and tagging us (with permission)
social_sharing_bonus.structure: Instant - show post at delivery, get gift card
social_sharing_bonus.promotion: Mentioned at delivery: 'Tag us in your first photo and we'll Venmo you $50'

trade_in_referral.offer: Refer someone to trade in their car (even if they don't buy) - get $100 when we purchase it
trade_in_referral.structure: Expands inventory, rewards customer for bringing deals
trade_in_referral.promotion: 'Know someone who needs to sell their car? We pay you $100 if we buy it'

review_incentive.offer: Leave honest Google review, get entered in monthly $500 drawing
review_incentive.structure: One entry per review, drawing held monthly, winner announced on social
review_incentive.promotion: QR code at delivery links to review page, monthly winner spotlight creates social proof

employee_referral_public.offer: Our staff gets $300 for referrals - ask your salesperson for their personal code
employee_referral_public.structure: Makes salespeople invested in customer satisfaction (happy customers refer)
employee_referral_public.promotion: Transparency builds trust - 'Yes we pay our team for referrals because that's how confident we are you'll love us'
